Description: Long, bag-type red wool sprang hair-net; decorated with yellow and green woollen stripes down the long sides; thick, yellow woollen draw strings and a brow band of grey-brown (originally mauve?); design in main area of small and large lozenges, achieved by reversing direction of linking; brow band and plaited ribbon was sewn to one side of the opening, opposite this the thick yellow draw cord passes twice through loops of warp threads (c.1.5cm long); ends of the draw cord neatly looped through the ends of the brow band; long, central section of craw cord missing; across the bottom of the bag a matching knotted length of draw string is threaded through the chain of warp threads, being the central line of the web; warp- red wool (S spun Z ply/c.12-16); plaited ribbon in wool (S); sewing with brown/mauve wool (S spun Z ply); seams are top-sewn; ribbon is top sewn to the main web; darning in the area below main draw string is in red wool (S spun Z ply); brow band consists of a 6 (?) strand plaits, a group of several threads making up one plait; cords are S-spun, and several (10 or more) are Z-ply, and 2 S-twisted; four original edges remain - two simple selvedges, one end with loops and the other with very short loops sewn to the ribbon; smell of aromatic oil - wear or burial? and dirty throughout
